@peterjc123 I don't know if this is being fixed but when using your windows conda package I cannot debug through backward. Also if an exception is raised in the backward method of functions my python kernel just dies with no messages. For example in the following dummy code python just dies:

import torch
from torch import autograd

class DoNothingFunction(autograd.Function):
    
    @staticmethod
    def forward(ctx, x):
        return x
        
    @staticmethod
    def backward(ctx, gx):
        raise RuntimeError
        return gx

x = autograd.Variable(torch.rand(10), requires_grad=True)
y = DoNothingFunction.apply(x)
y.backward(torch.rand(*y.size()))
